sen.j: 巨勢奈弖麻呂（こせのなでまろ、天智天皇9年（670年） - 天平勝宝5年3月30日 (旧暦)（753年5月11日））は、飛鳥時代・奈良時代の貴族。
sen.e: Kose no Nademaro (670 - May 11, 753) was a court noble in the Asuka period and Nara period.
KOSE no Nademaro (670 - May 11, 753) was a court noble in the Asuka period and Nara period.
KOSE no Nademaro (670 - May 11, 753) was a court noble in the Asuka period and Nara period.

sen.j: 最高位は従二位・大納言。
sen.e: His highest position was Junii (Junior Second Rank) Dainagon (chief councilor of state).
His highest position was Junii (Junior Second Rank) Dainagon (chief councilor of state).
His highest position was Junii (Junior Second Rank) Dainagon (chief councilor of state).

sen.j: 御史大夫巨勢人（人）の子。
sen.e: He was a son of gyoshi taifu (a chief of controlling officials) Kose no Hito (personnel).
He was a son of gyoshi taifu (a chief of controlling officials) KOSE no Hito.
sen.cmt: Kose→KOSEに修正* 「巨勢人（人）」とありますが、ウェブ上では「巨勢比等（人）」となっており、リンク先の単語が表示されているようです。ここでの（人）は「比等」の別表記と思われるため、訳文の(personnel)を削除しました。
sen.e: He was a son of gyoshi taifu (a chief of controlling officials) KOSE no Hito.

sen.j: ６７２年の壬申の乱で父比等が、弘文天皇側につき敗れた。
sen.e: In the Jinshin War occurred in 672, his father Hito sided with the Emperor Kobun and was defeated.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: In the Jinshin War occurred in 672, his father Hito sided with the Emperor Kobun and was defeated.
In the Jinshin War occurred in 672, his father Hito sided with the Emperor Kobun and was defeated.

sen.j: 乱後当時3歳の奈弖麻呂がどのような境遇にあったかは不明であるが、一族と共に配流されていたと推測される。
sen.e: Nademaro was three years old at the time and his situation is unknown, but it is presumed that he was in exile together with other family members.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: Nademaro was three years old at the time and his situation is unknown, but it is presumed that he was in exile together with other family members.
Nademaro was three years old at the time and his situation is unknown, but it is presumed that he was in exile together with other family members.

sen.j: ７２９年に従五位下に叙せられた時はすでに59歳であった。
sen.e: He was already 59 years old when he was conferred Jugoi no Ge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) in 729.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: He was already 59 years old when he was conferred Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) in 729.
sen.cmt: 統一リストに基づき、Jugoi no Ge→Jugoinogeに修正
sen.e: He was already 59 years old when he was conferred Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) in 729.

sen.j: ７３９年に参議に任ぜられ、69歳にして公卿に列す。
sen.e: He was appointed as sangi (councilor) in 739 and became a member of kugyo (the top court officials) at the age of 69.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: He was appointed as sangi (councilor) in 739 and became a member of kugyo (the top court officials) at the age of 69.
He was appointed as sangi (councilor) in 739 and became a member of kugyo (the top court officials) at the age of 69.

sen.j: 恭仁京造宮卿・留守官を経て、７４５年には中納言に昇進する。
sen.e: After serving as Zoeikyo (minister for making and Mending Palaces) of Kuni-kyo capital and Rusukan (officer to guard while master's away), he was promoted to Chunagon (vice- councilor of state) in 745.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: After serving as Zoeikyo (minister for making and Mending Palaces) of Kuni-kyo capital and Rusukan (officer to guard while master's away), he was promoted to Chunagon (vice- councilor of state) in 745.

After serving as Zoeikyo (minister for making and Mending Palaces) of Kuni-kyo capital and Rusukan (officer to guard while master's away), he was promoted to Chunagon (vice- councilor of state) in 745.

sen.j: ７４６年には元正上皇の御在所で歌を詠む。
sen.e: In 746, he composed a waka poem at the palace of the Retired Emperor Gensho.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: In 746, he composed a waka poem at the palace of the Retired Empress Gensho.
sen.cmt: 元正上皇→女帝のため、the Retired Empress Genshoとしました。
sen.e: In 746, he composed a waka poem at the palace of the Retired Empress Gensho.

sen.j: ７４９年にはすでに80歳近かったが、極官の大納言に昇進する。
sen.e: He was promoted to Dainagon, the highest official post, in 749 when he was near 80 years old.
He was promoted to Dainagon, the highest official post, in 749 when he was near 80 years old.
He was promoted to Dainagon, the highest official post, in 749 when he was near 80 years old.

sen.j: ７５２年の大仏開眼時には東宮留守官を務め、７５３年に薨去。
sen.e: He served as the Rusukan of the Crown Prince on the occasion of Daibutsu Kaigan (the ceremony to consecrate the Great Buddha) in 752, and died in 753.
He served as the Rusukan of the Crown Prince on the occasion of Daibutsu Kaigen (the ceremony to consecrate the Great Buddha) in 752, and died in 753.
He served as the Rusukan of the Crown Prince on the occasion of Daibutsu Kaigen (the ceremony to consecrate the Great Buddha) in 752, and died in 753.
His age at death was 84.
His age at death was 84.
His age at death was 84.

sen.j: この時代の人物としてはかなりの長寿を保った。
sen.e: He lived considerably long among the people of that time.
He lived considerably long among the people of that time.
He lived considerably long among the people of that time.
